result.execSummary:
The defendant Eric J Hohm was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver Heroin (<3g), a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(d)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Waukesha County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
Defendant is NOT eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program and IS Eligible for Substance Abuse Program.
Consecutive to: Any Other Sentence

superMiscConds.notes: Reimbursement for Buy Money to be paid/forwarded to Waukesha Co Clerk of Courts for Waukesha County Metro Drug Unit. Costs to be paid as a condition of Extended Supervision.

Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment, counseling.  No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety. No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription. Valid prescriptions only with prior agent approval and to be taken only in the manner they are ordered. Inform Agent of all prescriptions.

Maintain /work toward employment and/or school combination. Provide DNA Specimen unless previously obtained. Comply with any Mental Health / Psychological evaluation and treatment deemed appropriate. Follow through with any treatment or counseling recommended by agent. 
  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.

supervisions.notes: Transfer is allowed to the State of Georgia as allowed by the Interstate Compact, for Extended Supervision Only.

records.addlTxt: Transcript received and filed for the following date and event: 11/23/16 Plea and sentencing transcript. Filed by Cheryl Humpal.

records.descr: Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Eric J Hohm in court, in custody, with attorney Nicholas Martinez.   Melissa J. Zilavy appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant enters a guilty plea to count # 1. Court performs plea colloquy and finds defendant guilty of count #1, repeater stricken. 
Case #16CF457 is dismissed and read in. State gives sentencing recommendations. Atty Martinez makes statements regarding sentencing. Defendant makes Statements. The Defendant was sentenced to the following:

COUNT #1

IMPOSED SENTENCE OF:   

_____3 YEARS  (CREDIT - 0 days)				***CONSECUTIVE TO ANY OTHER SENTENCE***
  -  _____ 18 MONTHS OF INITIAL CONFINEMENT
  -  _____ 18 MONTHS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISON 	***TRANSFER ALLOWED TO STATE OF GEORGIA AS ALLOWED BY INTERSTATE COMPACT, FOR ES ONLY***

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISON:  
____AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
____Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
____No Use or Possession of alcohol or illegal drugs 
____No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
____Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are 
prescribed.
____Inform Agent of all prescriptions
____Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
____Maintain/work toward employment and/or combination of schooling 
____DNA sample to be provided if not yet previously done 
____Mental Heath / Psychological Evaluation and treatment deemed appropriate

$60.00 buy money to be paid to Waukesha County Metro Unit. 

COSTS:  $268.00 + $250.00 DNA surcharge (to be paid as a condition of extended supervision)

Defendant  is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.

Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.
(Fax) Dated 11/15/16, from Atty Martinez to Judge Carter, requesting all of the Defendant's cases get set for plea/sentencing tomorrow.
Plea/sentencing hearing on November 23, 2016 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Eric J Hohm in court, in custody, with attorney Nicholas Martinez.   Lesli S Boese appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Bail remains as fixed.  Attorney Martinez requests a plea/sentencing date as soon as possible.  Court directs the Sheriff to have Mr Hohm remain in the Waukesha County Jail until the next hearing.   NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED. Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 31, 2016 at 03:45 pm.
Hearing on October 21, 2016 at 10:00 am.
